title: Introduction to Algorithms
author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein
description: Comprehensive textbook covering foundational algorithms and data structures used in computer science.

title: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, John Vlissides
description: Seminal book introducing common software design patterns and best practices for object-oriented design.

title: Deep Learning
author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville
description: Foundational text that explains deep learning algorithms, theory, and modern neural network architectures.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: Guide to building successful startups using validated learning, rapid experimentation, and agile principles.

title: The Psychology of Money
author: Morgan Housel
description: Insights on financial behavior and how emotions, biases, and habits influence money decisions.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Explores two systems of thinking—fast, intuitive thinking and slow, analytical thinking—and their impact on decisions.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel following a young shepherd's journey to find his personal legend and purpose.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
description: Personal finance classic explaining the mindset differences between the wealthy and the middle class.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A powerful reflection on finding meaning through suffering and resilience, based on the author's Holocaust experiences.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A counterintuitive guide to living a good life by focusing on what truly matters.
